column17: The incident occurred near the Allenby Bridge border crossing in Amman.
column18: 01/14/2010: On Thursday afternoon around 1500, near the Allenby Bridge border crossing in Amman, Amman, Jordan, a roadside bomb detonated targeting the convoy of an Israeli Ambassador, Danny Nevo, but caused no casualties or damages. Nevo was not present during the attack, and no group claimed responsibility.
column39: The target was the convoy of an Israeli ambassador, Danny Nevo.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is to intimidate Israeli government.
column97: A roadside bomb leaving a crater 10 cm deep and 80 cm wide was used in the attack.
column130: \"\"Jordan Confirms Bomb Near Israeli Embassy Convoy"
column135: \"\"Bomb Targets Israeli Diplomatic Convoy in Jordan"

column18: 08/02/2010: On Monday, in Aqaba, Al Aqabah, Jordan, unknown assailants fired four rockets killing one person and injuring four others. No group claimed responsibility and no damage was reported.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Four rockets were used in the attack.
column127: \"\"One Killed And Four Injured as Rocket Hits Jordanian City of Aqaba"
column132: \"\"Rockets Hit Near Israeli City of Eilat"

column18: 07/12/2012: An explosive device was discovered in Ar Ramtha city, Irbid, Jordan. Police found the device in the car of a Jordanian who had been sheltering thousands of Syrian refugees. Authorities dismantled the device without incident. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
column97: An explosive device consisting of a receiver for remote-detonation was used in the attack.

column18: 05/15/2013: An explosives-laden vehicle was discovered and defused in the Abdun area, Amman city, Capital Governorate, Jordan. No further information is available.
